title: serif font for book cover
content:
I don't know anything about this font, but I'm designing some marketing material for it and the creator lost all of the original files used for the book cover.

Font: 

 Ringbearer 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112845/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Daniel\_Swensen\_-\_Google\_.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112845/http:/typophile.com/files/Daniel_Swensen_-_Google_.png) | 831.49 KB |
author: fidlet

comments.content:
It must be based on **[Ringbearer (Medium)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112845/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-2&ffam=Ringbearer%20-%20Medium&fid=bec1dc061960782df16e73f9881c9829&fsize=60&text=ORISON&fit=1)** by Pete Klassen [2002, Free for personal use]  
It actually has some of the "cracks" present in your sample
